alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Kaibab Plateau; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Marble and Glen Canyons; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 7:14PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A line of thunderstorms with blowing dust will impact portions of Coconino County through 745 PM MST... At 712 PM MST, the public reported blowing dust near Cameron moving toward Highway 89 ahead of a line of thunderstorms. Gusty winds, blowing dust with lowered visibility, and torrential rain can all be expected. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. Blowing dust. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Tuba City, LeChee, Marble Canyon, The Gap, Cedar Ridge, Moenave, Gray Mountain, Lees Ferry, Antelope Creek Basin, Bitter Springs, Moenkopi, Hopi, Antelope Canyon, Cameron, Waterholes Canyon and Kaibito. This includes the following highways... State Route 264 between mile markers 322 and 335. State Route 64 between mile markers 274 and 295. Highway 160 between mile markers 312 and 330. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 455 and 544. U.S. Highway 89A between mile markers 524 and 545. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Pull aside, stay alive. Slow down if you encounter low visibility due to dust.
